Classes/RegularExpression/Group.html#/s:.name: range
Classes/RegularExpression/Group.html#/s:.abstract: The range of the search string for this capture group of nil if this capture group did not participate in the match.

Classes/RegularExpression/Group.html#/s:.name: subString
Classes/RegularExpression/Group.html#/s:.abstract: The substring of the search string for this capture group of nil if this capture group did not participate in the match.

Classes/RegularExpression/Match.html#/s:.name: startIndex
Classes/RegularExpression/Match.html#/s:.abstract: The index of the first capture group.

Classes/RegularExpression/Match.html#/s:.name: endIndex
Classes/RegularExpression/Match.html#/s:.abstract: The index just past the last capture group.

Classes/RegularExpression/Match.html#/s:.name: range
Classes/RegularExpression/Match.html#/s:.abstract: The range within the search string for the entire match.

Classes/RegularExpression/Match.html#/s:.name: subString
Classes/RegularExpression/Match.html#/s:.abstract: The sub-string of the entire match region.

Classes/RegularExpression/Match.html#/s:.name: subscript(_:)
Classes/RegularExpression/Match.html#/s:.abstract: Returns the capture group for the given index.

Classes/RegularExpression/Match.html#/s:.name: makeIterator()
Classes/RegularExpression/Match.html#/s:.abstract: Returns an iterator over all the capture groups.

Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingFlags..name: progress
Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingFlags..abstract: Set when the Block is called to report progress during a long-running match operation.

Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingFlags..name: completed
Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingFlags..abstract: Set when the Block is called after matching has completed.

Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingFlags..name: hitEnd
Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingFlags..abstract: Set when the current match operation reached the end of the search range.

Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingFlags..name: requiredEnd
Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingFlags..abstract: Set when the current match depended on the location of the end of the search range.

Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingFlags..name: internalError
Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingFlags..abstract: Set when matching failed due to an internal error.

Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingOption.name: reportProgress
Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingOption.abstract: Call the Block periodically during long-running match operations. This option has no effect for methods other than forEachMatch(in:options:range:using:). See

Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingOption.name: reportCompletion
Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingOption.abstract: Call the Block once after the completion of any matching. This option has no effect for methods other than forEachMatch(in:options:range:using:). See

Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingOption.name: anchored
Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingOption.abstract: Specifies that matches are limited to those at the start of the search range. See forEachMatch(in:options:range:using:) for a description of the constant in context.

Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingOption.name: withTransparentBounds
Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingOption.abstract: Specifies that matching may examine parts of the string beyond the bounds of the search range, for purposes such as word boundary detection, lookahead, etc. This

Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingOption.name: withoutAnchoringBounds
Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingOption.abstract: Specifies that ^ and $ will not automatically match the beginning and end of the search range, but will still match the beginning and end of the entire string. This

Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html#/.name: allowCommentsAndWhitespace
Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html#/.abstract: Ignore whitespace and #-prefixed comments in the pattern.

Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html#/.name: ignoreMetacharacters
Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html#/.abstract: Treat the entire pattern as a literal string.

Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html#/.name: dotMatchesLineSeparators
Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html#/.abstract: Allow . to match any character, including line separators.

Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html#/.name: anchorsMatchLines
Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html#/.abstract: Allow ^ and $ to match the start and end of lines.

Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html#/.name: useUnixLineSeparators
Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html#/.abstract: Treat only \n as a line separator (otherwise, all standard line separators are used).

Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html#/.name: useUnicodeWordBoundaries
Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html#/.abstract: Use Unicode TR#29 to specify word boundaries (otherwise, traditional regular expression word boundaries are used).

Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html.name: Options
Classes/RegularExpression/Options.html.abstract: These constants define the regular expression options. These constants are used by init(pattern:options:).

Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingOption.name: MatchingOptions
Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingOption.abstract: The matching options constants specify the reporting, completion and matching rules to the expression matching methods. These constants are used by all methods that search

Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingFlags..name: MatchingFlags
Classes/RegularExpression/MatchingFlags..abstract: Set by the Block as the matching progresses, completes, or fails. Used by the method forEachMatch(in:options:range:using:).

Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.name: numberOfCaptureGroups
Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.abstract: The number of capture groups in the pattern.

Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.name: init(pattern:options:error:)
Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.abstract: Returns an initialized RegularExpression instance with the specified regular expression pattern and options. If an error occurs then nil is returned.

Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.name: init(pattern:options:)
Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.abstract: Returns an initialized RegularExpression instance with the specified regular expression pattern and options. If an error occurs then nil is returned.

Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.name: escapedPattern(for:)
Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.abstract: Returns a string by adding backslash escapes as necessary to protect any characters that would match as pattern metacharacters.

Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.name: escapedTemplate(for:)
Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.abstract: Returns a template string by adding backslash escapes as necessary to protect any characters that would match as pattern metacharacters

Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.name: numberOfMatches(in:options:range:)
Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.abstract: Returns the number of matches of the regular expression within the specified range of the string.

Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.name: rangeOfFirstMatch(in:options:range:)
Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.abstract: Returns the range of the first match.

Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.name: firstMatch(in:options:range:)
Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.abstract: Returns the first RegularExpression.Match found in the search string.

Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.name: matches(in:options:range:)
Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.abstract: Returns all of the RegularExpression.Matchs found in the search string.

Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.name: forEachMatch(in:options:range:using:)
Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.abstract: Enumerates the string allowing the Block to handle each regular expression match.

Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.name: forEachMatchGroup(in:options:range:using:)
Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.abstract: Enumerates the string allowing the Block to handle each regular expression match.

Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.name: forEachMatchString(in:options:range:using:)
Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.abstract: Enumerates the string allowing the Block to handle each regular expression match.

Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.name: stringByReplacingMatches(in:options:range:withTemplate:)
Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.abstract: RegularExpression also provides a find-and-replace method for strings. The replacement is treated as a template, with $0 being replaced by the contents of the matched

Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.name: stringByReplacingMatches(in:options:range:using:)
Classes/RegularExpression.html#/s:17Regu.abstract: This method will perform a find-and-replace on the provided string by calling the closure for each match found in the source string and replacing it with the string

Classes/RegularExpression/Match.html.name: Match
Classes/RegularExpression/Match.html.abstract: This class encapsulates all of the capture groups of a single match.

Classes/RegularExpression/Group.html.name: Group
Classes/RegularExpression/Group.html.abstract: This class encapsulates a single capture group.

Classes/RegularExpression/NamedGroup.htm.name: NamedGroup
Classes/RegularExpression/NamedGroup.htm.abstract: This class encapsulates a single named capture group.
